title: Quality Assurance Review Analysts (Winchester, VA)
description: Job DescriptionCome join our team! Dewberry is currently searching for Quality Assurance Review Analysts who reside in the Winchester, VA area who are interested in working days, nights or weekends supporting victims impacted by natural disasters across the United States. What an excellent opportunity to earn extra income while helping others. Succesful candidates must be proficient with the computer and able to work onsite in a professional office environment. Local candidates preferred, no housing or travel stipend will be provided.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more 50 locations and 2,000 professions nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors is our outstanding employees and more than 30 years of experience supporting FEMA. Our proven experience gives us unique insight into how national disaster events are prepared for, managed, and applied to communities. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. As one of our Disaster Specialists, you will have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on meaningful assignments in impacted disaster locations. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from our defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Responsibilities Identification and reporting of quality data internally and externally  Primary responsibility for oversight of Review Queue production; heavy involvement in Review Queue production  Proactive interaction with field staff, QC processes, NPSC, No Contact, Customer Service and Production departments  Assists in reconciliation and special project research as needed  Ensures adherence across the project to FEMA and Dewberry Codes of Conduct  Ability to communicate effectively in writing to develop and write work procedures, policies, reports, instructions, briefings and other documents  Ability to work among a diverse staff in effectively meeting program goals and unexpected workload changes related to disaster assistance activities  Maintain a familiarity with the FEMA software, implement new program updates and advise appropriate staff of any program changes  Assigning and reviewing work with subordinates, training and working effectively with subordinates from a variety of backgrounds and with different levels/areas of training  Assign and review the work of subordinates to ensure they are producing the quality and quantity of work expected within set limits of cost and time  Field questions and provide guidance for internal and external customers  Other duties as assigned Required Skills & Required Experience High School diploma required; Associates degree or equivalent preferred from an accredited university  A minimum of two (2) years of experience in related field is preferred  Must be able to travel and work onsite at Winchester, VA office  Prior experience with NEMIS is preferred  Proficiency with Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook and Teams) and database software required  Ideal candidates need to be flexible due to varying schedules/shift and able to work overtime  Successful candidates will possess a positive attitude, strong work ethic, and desire to help others  Strong interpersonal skills surrounding customer relations and supporting others are required  Must have a clean driving record and able to maintain a valid driver's license  Must be a U.S. Citizen and able to successfully pass a Federal background investigation, to include credit and criminal history At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.This position is covered by the McNamara-O'Hara Service Contract Act of 1965 (SCA).Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or sexual orientation.Only recipients of an offer of employment from Dewberry, will be required to submit to a background screening which may include, but is not limited to, employment verification, educational and other credential verification, driving record check, criminal background check, and an investigative consumer report. These screenings will be conducted by Dewberry’s background vendor of choice and will be conducted in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local law.

title: Climate Scientist
description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. Scientists provide essential data and insights about climate trends and potential impacts, guiding planners and engineers in designing resilient infrastructure, sustainable urban development, and effective mitigation strategies. This interdisciplinary approach ensures that solutions are grounded in scientific understanding while also being practical and impactful in the real worldDewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Notice to Third Party Recruiters: Dewberry only compensates job placement recruiters that have a valid Dewberry-approved written agreement in place for recruiting services. Dewberry does not compensate third party recruiters for unsolicited job placement candidate information.ResponsibilitiesServe as a subject matter expert and technical leader in applying climate science and interpreting climate model output for climate resilience and adaptation projects such as design guidelines/regulations, plans/policies, risk/vulnerability assessments, and infrastructure designSupport diverse projects teams in obtaining, analyzing, interrogating, and interpreting climate data, using robust statistical and data analytic techniques.Lead risk tolerance conversations with varied stakeholder audiences including infrastructure owners, elected officials, community members and design professionals, by sharing projections of how climate hazards will evolve, including considerations of uncertainty, in an accessible way.Stay abreast of emerging science, law, policy, data products and tools relevant to climate science and climate resiliency.Contribute to the development of hazard models and consequence assessments by working with multiple sectoral teams (energy, water, transportation, etc.) to forecast impact thresholds at which critical assets and systems may be disrupted or damaged.Participate in professional organizations related to atmospheric science, meteorology, or related fields and present in such forums.Minimum Qualifications Required Skills & Required Experience Advanced degree(MS or PhD) in atmospheric science, meteorology, climate science, or related physical sciences3-5+ years experience with quantitative analysis of geophysical phenomena and related datasets is required. Experience in statistical and probabilistic analysis of large geophysical data setsCollegial teammate and collaboratorExcellent communication and writing skills, including translation of complex technical information into accessible formats for a range of stakeholdersPreferred SkillsProficiency in R, Python, or MATLABFamiliarity with virtues and limitations of the latest global climate modelsLarge dataset management and visualization capabilitiesExperience providing climate expertise for planning and engineering projectsThe projected salary range for this position is $65,000-84,000 annually in our New York office.Don’t meet every single requirement? At Dewberry we are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace for our employee’s. So if you’re excited about this role, but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the position description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other opportunities. Must have a valid driver’s license, good driving record and ability to pass a driving record background check. At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Only recipients of an offer of employment from Dewberry, will be required to submit to a background screening which may include, but is not limited to, employment verification, educational and other credential verification, driving record check, criminal background check, and an investigative consumer report. These screenings will be conducted by Dewberry’s background vendor of choice and will be conducted in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local law.Notice to Third Party Recruiters: Dewberry only compensates job placement recruiters that have a valid Dewberry-approved written agreement in place for recruiting services. Dewberry does not compensate third party recruiters for unsolicited job placement candidate information. Salary Range The projected salary range for this position is $65,000-84,000 annually in our New York office.

title: FEMA-Data Specialists (Nationwide)
description: Job Description FEMA-Data Specialists (Nationwide) Are you looking for a rewarding opportunity to utilize your skills and experience helping your country and supporting our Direct Housing Management team? Dewberry is currently searching for junior and mid- level  D ata Input  and Data Analysts to work onsite at a Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) facility with the United States. Our ideal candidates are those with prior FEMA experience having used the grants management system.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more 50 locations and 2,000 professions nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors is our outstanding employees and more than 30 years of experience supporting FEMA. Our proven experience gives us unique insight into how national disaster events are prepared for, managed, and applied to communities. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from our defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.ResponsibilitiesDewberry's Data Specialists will travel to locations across the United States to support the FEMA Direct Housing Management team with data-related contract oversight and tracking activities. Responsibilities could include but not limited to: Creating and using pre-existing templates and spreadsheets in Microsoft Excel  Entering data into electronic databases and spreadsheets  Data maintenance and manipulation  Upload and downloading of files between multiple systems and applications  Training of government personnel on the spreadsheets and/or databases in use  Other administrative and clerical activities related to the direct housing mission  Preliminary analysis of the data may also be included in addition to the above activities  Data Analysts must be skilled in Power BI to compute, evaluate and present analysis results Required Skills & Required Experience High School diploma required; Bachelor’s degree preferred from an accredited university  Energetic, organized and detailed-oriented  Experience in data entry , analysis and management required  Proficiency with Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Power BI, Teams)  Excellent oral and written communication skills  Must be able to travel and work onsite at a FEMA facility  Ability to work a minimum 90 -day assignment ; working 8-12 hours per day, 5-7 days a week  Must have a clean driving record and able to maintain a valid driver's license in order to operate a company, personal or rental car  Must be a U.S. Citizen and able to successfully pass a Federal background investigation, to include financial and criminal history At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.This position is covered by the McNamara-O'Hara Service Contract Act of 1965 (SCA).Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. The position is located within either the Fairfax, Richmond, Roanoke, or Virginia Beach offices and is open to a hybrid schedule.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;  3 to 5 years of water resources engineering experience;  Strong working knowledge of Virginia Department of Transportation drainage design and hydrology and hydraulic analysis;  Knowledge/experience with the following models/software: HEC-RAS, Microstation, ArcGIS;  Experience in watershed and storm water management, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, drainage, erosion and sediment control, and watershed/waterway modeling;  Active EIT or P.E. in VA. title: Environmental Inspector
description: Job DescriptionThe project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45’ diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. description: Job DescriptionDewberry is currently seeking a Construction Inspector for our Jacksonville, FL office. description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. Scientists provide essential data and insights about climate trends and potential impacts, guiding planners and engineers in designing resilient infrastructure, sustainable urban development, and effective mitigation strategies. title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. title: Construction Inspector
description: Job DescriptionDewberry is currently seeking a Construction Inspector for our Jacksonville, FL office. Candidate will monitor contractor’s operations to ensure compliance with plans, contract terms and specifications. Individual will independently coordinate and direct all phases of construction inspection of projects which are typically complicated by traffic control, sensitive political or environmental concerns, or significant project coordination with property owners, utility companies, and local and federal government representatives. description: Job DescriptionDewberry is currently seeking a Construction Inspector for our Jacksonville, FL office. Candidate will monitor contractor’s operations to ensure compliance with plans, contract terms and specifications. Individual will independently coordinate and direct all phases of construction inspection of projects which are typically complicated by traffic control, sensitive political or environmental concerns, or significant project coordination with property owners, utility companies, and local and federal government representatives. title: Events Manager
description: About The DewberryExperience Southern Reimagined with a career at The Dewberry. Offering 154 thoughtfully appointed rooms, world-class service and unparalleled views, The Dewberry occupies the former L. Mendel Rivers (circa 1964) federal building and pays homage to Charleston’s mid-century architectural splendor. The hotel is the result of owner John Dewberry’s vision of “Southern Reimagined,” which he developed over the course of an eight-year renovation and preservation of the building. The hotel features several event spaces, the nationally celebrated cocktail program at the brass bar in The Living Room, high quality, the whimsical cocktail lounge Citrus Club and treatments using seafaring ingredients and low country botanicals in The Spa. title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. The position is located within either the Fairfax, Richmond, Roanoke, or Virginia Beach offices and is open to a hybrid schedule.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Responsibilities Conduct watershed and storm water management planning and design;  Perform water quality and quantity analysis to meet applicable state and local criteria;  Provide technical assistance for hydrologic and hydraulic analyses, using a variety of techniques and models (e.g., HEC-HMS, HY-8, HEC-RAS);  Floodplain mapping and assisting with written reports such as study narratives documenting floodplain studies;  Assist in preparation of proposals, work scopes, and cost estimates;  Perform roadway drainage design, culvert and bridge hydraulics, and floodplain analyses;  Project management and staff development. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;  3 to 5 years of water resources engineering experience;  Strong working knowledge of Virginia Department of Transportation drainage design and hydrology and hydraulic analysis;  Knowledge/experience with the following models/software: HEC-RAS, Microstation, ArcGIS;  Experience in watershed and storm water management, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, drainage, erosion and sediment control, and watershed/waterway modeling;  Active EIT or P.E. in VA. At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.All recipients of an offer of employment from Dewberry, will be required to submit to a background screening which may include, but is not limited to, employment verification, educational and other credential verification, driving record check, criminal background check, and an investigative consumer report. title: Climate Scientist
description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. Scientists provide essential data and insights about climate trends and potential impacts, guiding planners and engineers in designing resilient infrastructure, sustainable urban development, and effective mitigation strategies. This interdisciplinary approach ensures that solutions are grounded in scientific understanding while also being practical and impactful in the real worldDewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Dewberry does not compensate third party recruiters for unsolicited job placement candidate information.ResponsibilitiesServe as a subject matter expert and technical leader in applying climate science and interpreting climate model output for climate resilience and adaptation projects such as design guidelines/regulations, plans/policies, risk/vulnerability assessments, and infrastructure designSupport diverse projects teams in obtaining, analyzing, interrogating, and interpreting climate data, using robust statistical and data analytic techniques.Lead risk tolerance conversations with varied stakeholder audiences including infrastructure owners, elected officials, community members and design professionals, by sharing projections of how climate hazards will evolve, including considerations of uncertainty, in an accessible way.Stay abreast of emerging science, law, policy, data products and tools relevant to climate science and climate resiliency.Contribute to the development of hazard models and consequence assessments by working with multiple sectoral teams (energy, water, transportation, etc.) to forecast impact thresholds at which critical assets and systems may be disrupted or damaged.Participate in professional organizations related to atmospheric science, meteorology, or related fields and present in such forums.Minimum Qualifications Required Skills & Required Experience Advanced degree(MS or PhD) in atmospheric science, meteorology, climate science, or related physical sciences3-5+ years experience with quantitative analysis of geophysical phenomena and related datasets is required. Experience in statistical and probabilistic analysis of large geophysical data setsCollegial teammate and collaboratorExcellent communication and writing skills, including translation of complex technical information into accessible formats for a range of stakeholdersPreferred SkillsProficiency in R, Python, or MATLABFamiliarity with virtues and limitations of the latest global climate modelsLarge dataset management and visualization capabilitiesExperience providing climate expertise for planning and engineering projectsThe projected salary range for this position is $70,000-90,000 annually in our California office.Don’t meet every single requirement? title: Construction Inspector
description: Job DescriptionDewberry is currently seeking a Construction Inspector for our Jacksonville, FL office. Candidate will monitor contractor’s operations to ensure compliance with plans, contract terms and specifications. Individual will independently coordinate and direct all phases of construction inspection of projects which are typically complicated by traffic control, sensitive political or environmental concerns, or significant project coordination with property owners, utility companies, and local and federal government representatives. Coordinates and schedules various phases of construction with the prime contractor and other agencies; reviews and monitors contractors' plan of operation; and advises contractors of violations and recommends adjustments to operations. FLDOT certifications, including knowledge of pipeline construction methods, materials, standards and specifications. Working knowledge of mathematics including algebra, geometry, and trigonometry. description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. title: Front Desk Host
description: Experience Southern Reimagined with a career at The Dewberry. We are a tightknit group of passionate individuals who are unrelenting when it comes to offering a flawless Dewberry experience while maintaining our unique brand standards.About T He DewberryAs a 2022 Condé Nast Traveler Gold List award recipient for best hotel in the world, The Dewberry is located in the heart of downtown Charleston, bordering historic Marion Square, just steps from the shopping and dining on King Street, Museum Mile and The Gaillard Center. Offering 154 thoughtfully appointed rooms, world-class service and unparalleled views, The Dewberry occupies the former L. Mendel Rivers (circa 1964) federal building and pays homage to Charleston’s mid-century architectural splendor. The hotel is the result of owner John Dewberry’s vision of “Southern Reimagined,” which he developed over the course of an eight-year renovation and preservation of the building. The hotel features several event spaces, the nationally celebrated cocktail program at the brass bar in TheLiving Room, high quality, the whimsical cocktail lounge Citrus Club and treatments using seafaring ingredients and low country botanicals in The Spa. TheDewberry is committed to delivering a world-class experience to our discerning guests with a thoughtful approach and flawless execution. We are known among our teammates, our guests and our community as leaders in our field of hospitality who are authentic, humble and innovative operators driven to anticipate needs and exceed expectations.Position DescriptionPRIMARY FUNCTION: Front Desk HostDEPARTMENT: Front OfficeREPORTS TO: Front Office ManagerFront Desk HostSummaryThe Front Desk Host will oversee and direct all aspects of the guest experience utilizing 5 Star luxury standards to achieve the highest possible guest satisfaction.The focus of this role will be responsible for overseeing each guest’s arrival and departure, assisting with inquiries and requests, and managing the accuracy of guest folios. This role will contribute to the Hotel by helping to execute an unforgettable experience for our guests using sincere, anticipatory, and authentic service.Essential FunctionsMajor areas of responsibility/ management include, but are not limited to: Welcome guests in a warm and enthusiastic manner while always applying the 15-5 rule. Positive Tone of voice Good service posture Friendly smile Perform check-ins and check-outs, ensuring the highest level of service and complying with Leading Quality Assurance standards. Manages Room Key system. Promote the hotel and utilize upsell techniques when possible to maximize room revenue. Knowledgeable of all special promotions and room packages. Posts and files all charges to guest portfolio. Manage available room inventory and systematically block the house for arrivals. Coordinates room status updates by notifying Housekeeping of all check-outs, late check-outs, early check-ins, and special requests. Review guest charges and account balances in order to anticipate guest’s billing questions. Processes guest payments and gains credit authorizations following proper accounting procedures. Maintains cashier bank and ensures accurate daily report of all money received while utilizing proper cash-handling procedures. Utilize and follow-up on the work order system, “ALICE,” to expediate guest requests, maintenance requests, etc. Assist in making reservations and changes to itineraries, as necessary. Facilitates the Dewberry Drive Program. Works closing with all departments of the hotel to create memorable hotel stays for our guests. Familiar with all safety and emergency procedures and accident prevention policies. Build guest loyalty by recognizing returning guests and always using their name. Respond to guest requests with in 15 minutes when possible and ensure issues are resolved by always following up. Resolve guest challenges using guest recovery skills and escalate where appropriate. Uses a positive and clear speaking voice, shows active listening skills, and understands the importance of guest requests.Qualifications High school diploma/GED required. One-year hotel/hospitality experience and knowledge of hotel operations. One to two years customer service experience. Ability to work overtime, evenings, overnights, weekends or holidays based on business demands. Work positively in a team and enjoy interacting with people in a fast-paced environment . Ability to work and remain calm and professional under potentially stressful situations to ensure guest satisfaction, including difficult guests. Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational and time management skills. Strong knowledge of dataentry, computers, and MS Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Must be able to quickly adapt to using new software productsPhysical Demands and Work Environment Occasional bending, stooping, lifting up to fifty pounds, and pulling. Frequent sitting, walking and standing for up to 8 hours. Continuous repetitive actions.

title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. The position is located within either the Fairfax, Richmond, Roanoke, or Virginia Beach offices and is open to a hybrid schedule.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;  3 to 5 years of water resources engineering experience;  Strong working knowledge of Virginia Department of Transportation drainage design and hydrology and hydraulic analysis;  Knowledge/experience with the following models/software: HEC-RAS, Microstation, ArcGIS;  Experience in watershed and storm water management, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, drainage, erosion and sediment control, and watershed/waterway modeling;  Active EIT or P.E. in VA. description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. Scientists provide essential data and insights about climate trends and potential impacts, guiding planners and engineers in designing resilient infrastructure, sustainable urban development, and effective mitigation strategies. title: Events Manager
description: About The DewberryExperience Southern Reimagined with a career at The Dewberry. Mendel Rivers (circa 1964) federal building and pays homage to Charleston’s mid-century architectural splendor. The hotel is the result of owner John Dewberry’s vision of “Southern Reimagined,” which he developed over the course of an eight-year renovation and preservation of the building. The hotel features several event spaces, the nationally celebrated cocktail program at the brass bar in The Living Room, high quality, the whimsical cocktail lounge Citrus Club and treatments using seafaring ingredients and low country botanicals in The Spa. title: Resilience Planner
description: Job DescriptionDewberry is seeking a Resilience Planner to join our multi-disciplinary and action-oriented team (open to remote). This position will support the Resilience Solutions Group at the intersection of planning, policy, and technical analysis in hazard mitigation, emergency management, and climate change adaptation. Related areas of technical focus for this position include but are not limited to vulnerability assessment, hazard mitigation, community planning, natural resource management, and research and planning related to Federal agencies (FEMA, USACE, NOAA, and US F&WS), state agencies, and local communities.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Dewberry’s Resilience Solutions Group is an innovative organization that thrives on tackling the most intriguing resilience challenges across our nation. Our mission is to create safer and better communities for everyone to live in. We achieve this by embodying “Dewberry at Work” values and applying our expertise in engineering, planning, GIS, earth sciences, data analytics, and other technical disciplines. Our team assists federal, state, and local clients throughout the nation in comprehending their natural hazard risks. With our guidance, they can make informed decisions to reduce risk and increase resilience.Dewberry offers a comprehensive and very competitive package of insurance programs to regular full-time employees and their eligible dependents the first of the month following their date of hire. The insurance package includes: medical, dental, vision, and supplemental life. Additional insurances, at no cost to the employee: life (employee only), accidental death and dismemberment, business travel and accident, and short- and long-term disability are also provided. Employees pay a share of Dewberry’s premium expenses (on a pre-tax basis) for medical and dental insurance plans.Dewberry offers a wide range of other employee benefits, including: 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan, 529 College Savings Plans, Travel Assistance, Tuition Reimbursement, Flexible Spending Accounts and Supplemental Life Insurance for employee, spouse, and children.In addition, a host of discounted purchase programs are available to all employees.Notice to Third Party Recruiters: Dewberry only compensates job placement recruiters that have a valid Dewberry-approved written agreement in place for recruiting services. Dewberry does not compensate third party recruiters for unsolicited job placement candidate information.Responsibilities Support the exploration and execution of programmatic improvements to increase climate resilience and hazard mitigation within federal, state, and local government agencies.  Lead or support the facilitation of collaborative meetings as well as one-on-one discussions with partners, clients, and external stakeholders.  Develop and conducts public outreach for community resilience projects, both virtual and in-person.  Support the execution of technical studies and analytical processes relating to resilience strategy and plan development.  Research, analyze, and develop effective hazard mitigation policy and design solutions for local, state, and federal clients.  Employ a mix of written, visual, and verbal communication techniques to craft compelling narratives and explain complex technical topics to various audiences.  Prepare plans, studies, reports, guides, and other technical documents.  Conceptualize and supports the development of digital communication and decision-making tools, including data analytics dashboards, map viewers, StoryMaps, and custom web applications.  Apply principles of social equity and environmental justice to technical and strategic work.  Represent Dewberry in meetings with clients to resolve complex issues and to plan and coordinate work.  Assist Project Managers with developing technical and business proposals for new projects.  Work on a diverse array of related projects within the Resilience Solutions Group to acquire supplementary technical and programmatic knowledge/skills. Required Skills & Required ExperienceSkills & Required Experience Ability to effectively communicate orally and in written and visual formats technical information related to natural hazards and resilience in projects, presentations, and papers.  Ability to facilitate community outreach and engagement meetings with diverse stakeholders.  Experience researching, planning, and developing operational and tactical plans, policies, procedures, and guidance to promote resilience and mitigation.  2-9 years of experience.  Bachelor’s in Planning, Policy Analysis, Environmental Science, Sustainability, or another related field. Master’s degree preferred.  Ability to synthesize, analyze, and organize a large volume of complex information into a clear and coherent description.  Ability to be self-motivated and function both independently and in a collaborative team environment.  Well-developed time management skills, especially the ability to complete high-quality, detail-oriented deliverables on tight timelines amid competing deadlines within a diverse work group.  Ability to perform an expanded array of tasks assigned by senior-level staff, designed to broaden experience and familiarization with methods, practices, and programs applicable to the department.  Ability to exercise initiative, resourcefulness, and tact in obtaining and analyzing information related to resilience planning.  Ability to get along with coworkers and superiors. Optional (Nice to Have) Experience with client interactions, task management, and business development.  Comfort working with large geospatial datasets and performing or directing quantitative analyses.  Knowledge and ability to use the following computer applications: Tableau, Power BI, ArcMap/ArcPro, ArcGIS Online, Adobe InDesign, and other data processing, visualization, and design tools.  Certified Floodplain Manager or AICP. Work Environment Work environment responsibilities may occasionally require an adjusted work schedule, overtime, and evening/weekend hours in order to meet deadlines.  Occasionally, will be required to lift/carry up to 25 lbs.  Computers, telephones, copiers, and printers are all used to perform tasks.  Work is typically performed within an office, although field/site visits may be occasionally required.  Works under the supervision of higher-level staff. title: Front Desk Host
description: Experience Southern Reimagined with a career at The Dewberry. We are a tightknit group of passionate individuals who are unrelenting when it comes to offering a flawless Dewberry experience while maintaining our unique brand standards.About T He DewberryAs a 2022 Condé Nast Traveler Gold List award recipient for best hotel in the world, The Dewberry is located in the heart of downtown Charleston, bordering historic Marion Square, just steps from the shopping and dining on King Street, Museum Mile and The Gaillard Center. Offering 154 thoughtfully appointed rooms, world-class service and unparalleled views, The Dewberry occupies the former L. Mendel Rivers (circa 1964) federal building and pays homage to Charleston’s mid-century architectural splendor. The hotel is the result of owner John Dewberry’s vision of “Southern Reimagined,” which he developed over the course of an eight-year renovation and preservation of the building. The hotel features several event spaces, the nationally celebrated cocktail program at the brass bar in TheLiving Room, high quality, the whimsical cocktail lounge Citrus Club and treatments using seafaring ingredients and low country botanicals in The Spa. TheDewberry is committed to delivering a world-class experience to our discerning guests with a thoughtful approach and flawless execution. We are known among our teammates, our guests and our community as leaders in our field of hospitality who are authentic, humble and innovative operators driven to anticipate needs and exceed expectations.Position DescriptionPRIMARY FUNCTION: Front Desk HostDEPARTMENT: Front OfficeREPORTS TO: Front Office ManagerFront Desk HostSummaryThe Front Desk Host will oversee and direct all aspects of the guest experience utilizing 5 Star luxury standards to achieve the highest possible guest satisfaction.The focus of this role will be responsible for overseeing each guest’s arrival and departure, assisting with inquiries and requests, and managing the accuracy of guest folios. This role will contribute to the Hotel by helping to execute an unforgettable experience for our guests using sincere, anticipatory, and authentic service.Essential FunctionsMajor areas of responsibility/ management include, but are not limited to: Welcome guests in a warm and enthusiastic manner while always applying the 15-5 rule. Positive Tone of voice Good service posture Friendly smile Perform check-ins and check-outs, ensuring the highest level of service and complying with Leading Quality Assurance standards. Manages Room Key system. Promote the hotel and utilize upsell techniques when possible to maximize room revenue. Knowledgeable of all special promotions and room packages. Posts and files all charges to guest portfolio. Manage available room inventory and systematically block the house for arrivals. Coordinates room status updates by notifying Housekeeping of all check-outs, late check-outs, early check-ins, and special requests. Review guest charges and account balances in order to anticipate guest’s billing questions. Processes guest payments and gains credit authorizations following proper accounting procedures. Maintains cashier bank and ensures accurate daily report of all money received while utilizing proper cash-handling procedures. Utilize and follow-up on the work order system, “ALICE,” to expediate guest requests, maintenance requests, etc. Assist in making reservations and changes to itineraries, as necessary. Facilitates the Dewberry Drive Program. Works closing with all departments of the hotel to create memorable hotel stays for our guests. Familiar with all safety and emergency procedures and accident prevention policies. Build guest loyalty by recognizing returning guests and always using their name. Respond to guest requests with in 15 minutes when possible and ensure issues are resolved by always following up. Resolve guest challenges using guest recovery skills and escalate where appropriate. Uses a positive and clear speaking voice, shows active listening skills, and understands the importance of guest requests.Qualifications High school diploma/GED required. One-year hotel/hospitality experience and knowledge of hotel operations. One to two years customer service experience. Ability to work overtime, evenings, overnights, weekends or holidays based on business demands. Work positively in a team and enjoy interacting with people in a fast-paced environment . Ability to work and remain calm and professional under potentially stressful situations to ensure guest satisfaction, including difficult guests. Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational and time management skills. Strong knowledge of dataentry, computers, and MS Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Must be able to quickly adapt to using new software productsPhysical Demands and Work Environment Occasional bending, stooping, lifting up to fifty pounds, and pulling. Frequent sitting, walking and standing for up to 8 hours. Continuous repetitive actions.

title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. The position is located within either the Fairfax, Richmond, Roanoke, or Virginia Beach offices and is open to a hybrid schedule.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Responsibilities Conduct watershed and storm water management planning and design;  Perform water quality and quantity analysis to meet applicable state and local criteria;  Provide technical assistance for hydrologic and hydraulic analyses, using a variety of techniques and models (e.g., HEC-HMS, HY-8, HEC-RAS);  Floodplain mapping and assisting with written reports such as study narratives documenting floodplain studies;  Assist in preparation of proposals, work scopes, and cost estimates;  Perform roadway drainage design, culvert and bridge hydraulics, and floodplain analyses;  Project management and staff development. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;  3 to 5 years of water resources engineering experience;  Strong working knowledge of Virginia Department of Transportation drainage design and hydrology and hydraulic analysis;  Knowledge/experience with the following models/software: HEC-RAS, Microstation, ArcGIS;  Experience in watershed and storm water management, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, drainage, erosion and sediment control, and watershed/waterway modeling;  Active EIT or P.E. in VA. At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. title: Chief Information Officer (CIO)
description: Job DescriptionDewberry is currently seeking a Chief Information Officer (CIO) in the Washington, DC metro area.. As a key member of Dewberry’s executive team, the CIO will oversee the development and evolution of the organization’s information technology platform, including an anticipated fully integrated ERP implementation.The organization is focused on finding a strategic technology leader to assume responsibility for planning the technology road map, accelerating business growth, leading new project implementations, driving operation efficiencies, and stabilizing/securing current systems and processes. This is a highly visible, hands-on position that requires developing productive relationships with the executive leadership team and functional leaders to support and impact the entire organization.This role will oversee logistics including lease and vehicle management, security and building management. S/he will also oversee all aspects of cybersecurity.The selected candidate will be a self-motivated, creative thinker with strong organizational and technical skills. The CIO will promote Dewberry’s culture and values and be skilled at leading a team across multiple sites. S/he will utilize his/her extensive IT knowledge, people management, and change management experience to focus the team members around the most important goals and targets, build a culture of accountability, and deliver consistent performance and high-quality service. Excellent leadership and communications skills are imperative for this role as well as the ability to flourish in a dynamic environment and a customer service business.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Notice to Third Party Recruiters: Dewberry only compensates job placement recruiters that have a valid Dewberry-approved written agreement in place for recruiting services. Dewberry does not compensate third party recruiters for unsolicited job placement candidate information.Responsibilities Partner closely with Dewberry’s Executive and Senior Leadership teams to ensure execution of Dewberry’s strategic vision. Work closely with senior leadership to influence overall business strategy while establishing short- and long-term strategies related to the organization’s information management and systems that will positively impact the organization’s objectives.  Drive consistency in information technology + governance.  Act as a senior business advisor and partner to the executive team, prioritizing business objectives to provide tangible technology solutions in support of building and transforming the business.  Assess the current IT portfolio and assure that the portfolio is optimized to support innovation, enable improvements and achieve cost optimization. Build and demonstrate excellent IT value and performance across infrastructure, applications and IT operations, and implement systems and capabilities that advance the business strategy.  Create, maintain and share the IT strategic transformation roadmap that enables the future business capabilities model. Establish, manage, and leverage metrics program to implement improvements to services with an emphasis on continuous improvement.  Monitor the industry for developments in IT operations; evaluate and implement relevant new tools and service management frameworks; staying updated on IT trends and emerging technologies.  Monitor and maintain policies governing information security and business continuity. Leadership Responsibilities Leads, mentors, and develops a dynamic team of IT and logistic professionals.  Executive level management of vendors, contractors, and service providers to ensure Company’s high level of innovation and support.  Forge strong alliances with key senior business leaders, such as the Group Presidents, Business Unit Managers, marketing, HR, legal, and the CFO, ensuring that the senior leadership team has a shared view of agreed IT objectives, role and commitments.  Provide leadership to the team, while fostering a culture of accountability, growth, professional development, high-performance, and ethical behavior to build a dynamic IT team.  Emulate Dewberry’s core values day-to-day with internal and external interactions.  Cultivate a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging for all team members.  Hold team members accountable to clearly communicated objectives.  Be a positive thought and action leader, fostering exceptional communication and interaction between all company constituencies in a mission driven environment.  Embrace change. Seek out professional challenges and thrive in fast-paced and demanding environments. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree required; post-graduate degree preferred.  A minimum of 15 years of IT management, with a minimum of 5 years building and leading an IT team.  Understanding of multi-site operations and managing large scale technology solutions, while simultaneously drilling down to triage specific site.  Proven ability to build and execute thoughtful business plans to advocate for investing in advanced technology solutions.  Experience implementing an ERP system along with scalable, fully integrated solutions.  Ability to translate transformational business needs into practical, economical, workable product solutions that scale both technically and operationally.  Proven business process improvement professional with a six-sigma process mindset, with the ability to guide decision making on how to leverage technology to further automate after process enhancements have been realized.  Advanced analytics skills, able to organize and direct the team to develop insights to implement into and drive the business.  Strong cybersecurity background and ability to assess the current security state and develop policies and procedures around incident threat response planning.  Experience with FedRAMP, NIST, CCSP, GDPR, CISSP, or comparable compliance regulations.  Ability to manage the enterprise-wide information security governance process, working cross-functionally with other IT functions as needed.  Experience with office lease management, vehicle fleets and building maintenance.  Forward thinking, with a focus on building and continually enhancing high touchpoint consumer experiences  Strong, high energy, inspirational leadership style that builds culture, without sacrificing results and enforcing accountability. Genuine passion for being a part of a mission driven industry.  Proven ability to set individual team member objectives for strong performance management.  Executive level communication and negotiation skills. Ability to communicate across the internal organization and outside partners adapting style as needed for technical or non-technical audiences.  Excellent talent management skills with the ability to attract talent and create sustainable pipelines of talent, ready to support scale and growth.  Ability to de-escalate conflict, engaging multiple constituents when necessary to arrive at win-win solutions.  Financial acumen, budget and planning skills.  Either hold or have the ability to obtain a Top-Secret Security Clearance. D on’t meet every single requirement? title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. The position is located within either the Fairfax, Richmond, Roanoke, or Virginia Beach offices and is open to a hybrid schedule.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Whether you’re an experienced professional or a new graduate, you’ll have the chance to collaborate with the best and brightest and work on innovative and complex projects at the forefront of the industry. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Responsibilities Conduct watershed and storm water management planning and design;  Perform water quality and quantity analysis to meet applicable state and local criteria;  Provide technical assistance for hydrologic and hydraulic analyses, using a variety of techniques and models (e.g., HEC-HMS, HY-8, HEC-RAS);  Floodplain mapping and assisting with written reports such as study narratives documenting floodplain studies;  Assist in preparation of proposals, work scopes, and cost estimates;  Perform roadway drainage design, culvert and bridge hydraulics, and floodplain analyses;  Project management and staff development. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;  3 to 5 years of water resources engineering experience;  Strong working knowledge of Virginia Department of Transportation drainage design and hydrology and hydraulic analysis;  Knowledge/experience with the following models/software: HEC-RAS, Microstation, ArcGIS;  Experience in watershed and storm water management, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, drainage, erosion and sediment control, and watershed/waterway modeling;  Active EIT or P.E. in VA. At this time, Dewberry will not sponsor a new applicant for work authorization.Dewberry is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.All recipients of an offer of employment from Dewberry, will be required to submit to a background screening which may include, but is not limited to, employment verification, educational and other credential verification, driving record check, criminal background check, and an investigative consumer report. title: Climate Scientist
description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. Scientists provide essential data and insights about climate trends and potential impacts, guiding planners and engineers in designing resilient infrastructure, sustainable urban development, and effective mitigation strategies. This interdisciplinary approach ensures that solutions are grounded in scientific understanding while also being practical and impactful in the real worldDewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. title: Environmental Inspector
description: Job DescriptionThe project scope across a 9 mile section of the I-64 will include: a new 3.5-mile bridge-tunnel crossing that will accommodate a total of 8 lanes of capacity across the water, replacement of the existing marine approach bridges, and the addition of a third lane on I-64 in each direction. The twin 45’ diameter 1.5-mile tunnels will be bored by TBM, creating the second largest TBM tunnel opening for a TBM in North America. title: Climate Scientist
description: Job DescriptionDewberry has an excellent opportunity for a Climate Scientist to join our resilience team as we are expanding our capacity in infrastructure resilience planning and engineering. At Dewberry, our climate scientists, planners, and engineers collaborate to address the challenges posed by climate change. Scientists provide essential data and insights about climate trends and potential impacts, guiding planners and engineers in designing resilient infrastructure, sustainable urban development, and effective mitigation strategies. This interdisciplinary approach ensures that solutions are grounded in scientific understanding while also being practical and impactful in the real worldDewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. title: Events Manager
description: About The DewberryExperience Southern Reimagined with a career at The Dewberry. Offering 154 thoughtfully appointed rooms, world-class service and unparalleled views, The Dewberry occupies the former L. Mendel Rivers (circa 1964) federal building and pays homage to Charleston’s mid-century architectural splendor. The hotel is the result of owner John Dewberry’s vision of “Southern Reimagined,” which he developed over the course of an eight-year renovation and preservation of the building. The hotel features several event spaces, the nationally celebrated cocktail program at the brass bar in The Living Room, high quality, the whimsical cocktail lounge Citrus Club and treatments using seafaring ingredients and low country botanicals in The Spa. title: Resilience Planner
description: Job DescriptionDewberry is seeking a Resilience Planner to join our multi-disciplinary and action-oriented team (open to remote). This position will support the Resilience Solutions Group at the intersection of planning, policy, and technical analysis in hazard mitigation, emergency management, and climate change adaptation. Related areas of technical focus for this position include but are not limited to vulnerability assessment, hazard mitigation, community planning, natural resource management, and research and planning related to Federal agencies (FEMA, USACE, NOAA, and US F&WS), state agencies, and local communities.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. What sets us apart from our competitors are our people. At Dewberry, we seek out exceptional talent and strive to deliver the highest quality of services to our clients. Our commitment to excellence stems from our personal integrity and from other defining attributes, which we call “Dewberry at Work,” that have inspired our employees to be successful for more than a half-century.Dewberry’s Resilience Solutions Group is an innovative organization that thrives on tackling the most intriguing resilience challenges across our nation. Our mission is to create safer and better communities for everyone to live in. We achieve this by embodying “Dewberry at Work” values and applying our expertise in engineering, planning, GIS, earth sciences, data analytics, and other technical disciplines. Our team assists federal, state, and local clients throughout the nation in comprehending their natural hazard risks. With our guidance, they can make informed decisions to reduce risk and increase resilience.Dewberry offers a comprehensive and very competitive package of insurance programs to regular full-time employees and their eligible dependents the first of the month following their date of hire. The insurance package includes: medical, dental, vision, and supplemental life. Additional insurances, at no cost to the employee: life (employee only), accidental death and dismemberment, business travel and accident, and short- and long-term disability are also provided. Employees pay a share of Dewberry’s premium expenses (on a pre-tax basis) for medical and dental insurance plans.Dewberry offers a wide range of other employee benefits, including: 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan, 529 College Savings Plans, Travel Assistance, Tuition Reimbursement, Flexible Spending Accounts and Supplemental Life Insurance for employee, spouse, and children.In addition, a host of discounted purchase programs are available to all employees.Notice to Third Party Recruiters: Dewberry only compensates job placement recruiters that have a valid Dewberry-approved written agreement in place for recruiting services. Dewberry does not compensate third party recruiters for unsolicited job placement candidate information.Responsibilities Support the exploration and execution of programmatic improvements to increase climate resilience and hazard mitigation within federal, state, and local government agencies.  Lead or support the facilitation of collaborative meetings as well as one-on-one discussions with partners, clients, and external stakeholders.  Develop and conducts public outreach for community resilience projects, both virtual and in-person.  Support the execution of technical studies and analytical processes relating to resilience strategy and plan development.  Research, analyze, and develop effective hazard mitigation policy and design solutions for local, state, and federal clients.  Employ a mix of written, visual, and verbal communication techniques to craft compelling narratives and explain complex technical topics to various audiences.  Prepare plans, studies, reports, guides, and other technical documents.  Conceptualize and supports the development of digital communication and decision-making tools, including data analytics dashboards, map viewers, StoryMaps, and custom web applications.  Apply principles of social equity and environmental justice to technical and strategic work.  Represent Dewberry in meetings with clients to resolve complex issues and to plan and coordinate work.  Assist Project Managers with developing technical and business proposals for new projects.  Work on a diverse array of related projects within the Resilience Solutions Group to acquire supplementary technical and programmatic knowledge/skills. Required Skills & Required ExperienceSkills & Required Experience Ability to effectively communicate orally and in written and visual formats technical information related to natural hazards and resilience in projects, presentations, and papers.  Ability to facilitate community outreach and engagement meetings with diverse stakeholders.  Experience researching, planning, and developing operational and tactical plans, policies, procedures, and guidance to promote resilience and mitigation.  2-9 years of experience.  Bachelor’s in Planning, Policy Analysis, Environmental Science, Sustainability, or another related field. Master’s degree preferred.  Ability to synthesize, analyze, and organize a large volume of complex information into a clear and coherent description.  Ability to be self-motivated and function both independently and in a collaborative team environment.  Well-developed time management skills, especially the ability to complete high-quality, detail-oriented deliverables on tight timelines amid competing deadlines within a diverse work group.  Ability to perform an expanded array of tasks assigned by senior-level staff, designed to broaden experience and familiarization with methods, practices, and programs applicable to the department.  Ability to exercise initiative, resourcefulness, and tact in obtaining and analyzing information related to resilience planning.  Ability to get along with coworkers and superiors. Optional (Nice to Have) Experience with client interactions, task management, and business development.  Comfort working with large geospatial datasets and performing or directing quantitative analyses.  Knowledge and ability to use the following computer applications: Tableau, Power BI, ArcMap/ArcPro, ArcGIS Online, Adobe InDesign, and other data processing, visualization, and design tools.  Certified Floodplain Manager or AICP. Work Environment Work environment responsibilities may occasionally require an adjusted work schedule, overtime, and evening/weekend hours in order to meet deadlines.  Occasionally, will be required to lift/carry up to 25 lbs.  Computers, telephones, copiers, and printers are all used to perform tasks.  Work is typically performed within an office, although field/site visits may be occasionally required.  Works under the supervision of higher-level staff. Work is often reviewed for accuracy by senior staff.  Must be able to obtain and maintain a Public Trust security clearance. The projected salary range for this position is $92,000-118,000 annually in our New York, NY office. Depending upon other factors, i.e., skills, experience, location, market conditions, the range may vary slightly.Must have a valid driver’s license, good driving record and ability to pass a driving record background check.D on’t meet every single requirement? title: Front Desk Host
description: Experience Southern Reimagined with a career at The Dewberry. We are a tightknit group of passionate individuals who are unrelenting when it comes to offering a flawless Dewberry experience while maintaining our unique brand standards.About T He DewberryAs a 2022 Condé Nast Traveler Gold List award recipient for best hotel in the world, The Dewberry is located in the heart of downtown Charleston, bordering historic Marion Square, just steps from the shopping and dining on King Street, Museum Mile and The Gaillard Center. Offering 154 thoughtfully appointed rooms, world-class service and unparalleled views, The Dewberry occupies the former L. Mendel Rivers (circa 1964) federal building and pays homage to Charleston’s mid-century architectural splendor. The hotel is the result of owner John Dewberry’s vision of “Southern Reimagined,” which he developed over the course of an eight-year renovation and preservation of the building. The hotel features several event spaces, the nationally celebrated cocktail program at the brass bar in TheLiving Room, high quality, the whimsical cocktail lounge Citrus Club and treatments using seafaring ingredients and low country botanicals in The Spa. TheDewberry is committed to delivering a world-class experience to our discerning guests with a thoughtful approach and flawless execution. We are known among our teammates, our guests and our community as leaders in our field of hospitality who are authentic, humble and innovative operators driven to anticipate needs and exceed expectations.Position DescriptionPRIMARY FUNCTION: Front Desk HostDEPARTMENT: Front OfficeREPORTS TO: Front Office ManagerFront Desk HostSummaryThe Front Desk Host will oversee and direct all aspects of the guest experience utilizing 5 Star luxury standards to achieve the highest possible guest satisfaction.The focus of this role will be responsible for overseeing each guest’s arrival and departure, assisting with inquiries and requests, and managing the accuracy of guest folios. This role will contribute to the Hotel by helping to execute an unforgettable experience for our guests using sincere, anticipatory, and authentic service.Essential FunctionsMajor areas of responsibility/ management include, but are not limited to: Welcome guests in a warm and enthusiastic manner while always applying the 15-5 rule. Positive Tone of voice Good service posture Friendly smile Perform check-ins and check-outs, ensuring the highest level of service and complying with Leading Quality Assurance standards. Manages Room Key system. Promote the hotel and utilize upsell techniques when possible to maximize room revenue. Knowledgeable of all special promotions and room packages. Posts and files all charges to guest portfolio. Manage available room inventory and systematically block the house for arrivals. Coordinates room status updates by notifying Housekeeping of all check-outs, late check-outs, early check-ins, and special requests. Review guest charges and account balances in order to anticipate guest’s billing questions. Processes guest payments and gains credit authorizations following proper accounting procedures. Maintains cashier bank and ensures accurate daily report of all money received while utilizing proper cash-handling procedures. Utilize and follow-up on the work order system, “ALICE,” to expediate guest requests, maintenance requests, etc. Assist in making reservations and changes to itineraries, as necessary. Facilitates the Dewberry Drive Program. Works closing with all departments of the hotel to create memorable hotel stays for our guests. Familiar with all safety and emergency procedures and accident prevention policies. Build guest loyalty by recognizing returning guests and always using their name. Respond to guest requests with in 15 minutes when possible and ensure issues are resolved by always following up. Resolve guest challenges using guest recovery skills and escalate where appropriate. Uses a positive and clear speaking voice, shows active listening skills, and understands the importance of guest requests.Qualifications High school diploma/GED required. One-year hotel/hospitality experience and knowledge of hotel operations. One to two years customer service experience. Ability to work overtime, evenings, overnights, weekends or holidays based on business demands. Work positively in a team and enjoy interacting with people in a fast-paced environment . Ability to work and remain calm and professional under potentially stressful situations to ensure guest satisfaction, including difficult guests. Excellent verbal and written communication, organizational and time management skills. Strong knowledge of dataentry, computers, and MS Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Must be able to quickly adapt to using new software productsPhysical Demands and Work Environment Occasional bending, stooping, lifting up to fifty pounds, and pulling. Frequent sitting, walking and standing for up to 8 hours. Continuous repetitive actions.

title: Water Resources Engineer
description: Job DescriptionDewberry Engineers Inc. is seeking a Water Resources Engineer for the Water Resources Group within the Transportation Department in Virginia. The position offers great potential for professional growth and collaboration in a dynamic working environment on a growing team and an opportunity to provide innovative and creative design solutions to water resource projects. Typical projects involve assisting federal, state and local clients in completing stormwater management, floodplain management, hydraulic modeling, drainage design, resiliency design and other watershed planning for multiple project delivery methods. The position is located within either the Fairfax, Richmond, Roanoke, or Virginia Beach offices and is open to a hybrid schedule.Dewberry is a leading, market-facing professional services firm with more than 50 locations and 2,000 professionals nationwide. Required Skills & Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering;  3 to 5 years of water resources engineering experience;  Strong working knowledge of Virginia Department of Transportation drainage design and hydrology and hydraulic analysis;  Knowledge/experience with the following models/software: HEC-RAS, Microstation, ArcGIS;  Experience in watershed and storm water management, hydrologic and hydraulic analysis, drainage, erosion and sediment control, and watershed/waterway modeling;  Active EIT or P.E. in VA.
